data.text1: Click on the Applications tab

data.text1: Click on App Store

data.text1: Search for the Picker App

data.text1: Install the application by clicking on the "Install" button

data.text1: Navigates to the "Roles" page under "User Management" section
data.text3: Should be able to see all the roles that are created so far.

data.text1: Click on the "New Role" button in "Roles" page
data.text3: Role Info window should be visible with Role Name & Description fields

data.text1: Enter Role Name & Description and then click "Next"
data.text3: Permission window should be visible with all the permissions including Picker app. Under the Picker app these mentioned permissions should be included 1. Activate Picker 2. Deactivate Picker 3. Picker standard functionality

data.text1: Verify the default values of the permissions under Picker app
data.text3: All the permissions under Picker app should be unchecked by default

data.text1: Verify the information tool tip of the permissions under Picker app
data.text3: The permissions should contain these information in the tool tips |||:Permission|:Information || Activate Picker | User will be able to activate the picker application for the outlet with the given email and password. || Deactivate Picker | User will be able to deactivate the picker application by logging out. || Picker standard functionality | User will be able to access and manage orders by picking items, updating availability of items, substitutions and printing.

data.text1: Create a Delivery by Aggregator Grocery order with single item, item level comments and order level comments from Talabat
data.text3:
1. The order should be visible under the "Unclaimed" orders

2. The order count on the "Unclaimed" orders should be increased by 1

3. Below mentioned details should be included in the order under "Unclaimed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Cart icon

4. The "Claim" button should be enabled

data.text1: Click on the "Claim" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be claimed and navigated to order confirmation screen.

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item name
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable button of the item
   7. The image of the item saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)
   8. Item level comments
   9. Order level comments

3. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. "Confirm" button should be disabled

5. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

7. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

8. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Ongoing" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

9. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the "Ongoing" orders tab. 

10. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

data.text1: Mark the item as available by clicking on the available button
data.text3:
1. The item should be marked as available by appearing a green colour available icon on the item image.

2. Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be enabled.

4. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1: Click on the "Confirm" button on order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to complete the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Confirm" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on "Confirm" button on the confirmation window
data.text3:
1. The order should be completed and displayed a success message that saying "Order completed".

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

data.text1: Click on the "My orders" button
data.text3: Should navigated to the "My orders" section

data.text1: Click on the "Completed" button in "My orders" section
data.text3: Should be navigated to the "Completed" tab

data.text1: Click on the order
data.text3:
Should be navigated to the order details screen and should include below mentioned details

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item name
   5. Item quantity
   6. Availability of the item
   7. The image of the item saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)
   8. Item level comments
   9. Order level comments

data.text3:

2. The order count on the "Unclaimed" orders should be increased by 1

3. Below mentioned details should be included in the order under "Unclaimed" orders.

1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to cancel the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Cancel" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on the "Not Now" button
data.text3: The order should not be cancelled and the confirmation window should be closed

data.text1: Create a Delivery by Aggregator Grocery order from Talabat
data.text3:
1. The order should be visible under the "Unclaimed" orders.

2. The order count on the "Unclaimed" orders should be increased by 1

3. Below mentioned details should be included in the order under "Unclaimed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Cart icon

4. The "Claim" button should be enabled

data.text1: Click on the "Claim" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be claimed and navigated to order confirmation screen.

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable buttons for each item
   7. The images of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)

3. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

6. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

7. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Ongoing" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

8. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the "Ongoing" orders section. 

9. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

data.text1: Click on the order cancel button on the top of the order confirmation screen

data.text1: Click on the "X" icon on the confirmation window
data.text3: The order should not be cancelled and the confirmation window should be closed

data.text1: Mark all items as unavailable by clicking on the unavailable buttons
data.text3:
1. All the items should be marked as unavailable by appearing a red colour unavailable icon on each selected item image and the item names should be crossed through

2. Available button should be enabled and Unavailable button should be disabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be disabled.

4. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1: Click on the order cancel button on the top of the order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to cancel the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Cancel" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on the "Cancel" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be cancelled and displayed a cancelation message that saying "Order cancelled!"

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

4. Order status should be displayed as "Cancelled" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Cancelled" on the top of the order confirmation screen.

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCancelled" in GrubOps 2.0.

   2. Source
   3. Cart icon

4. The "Claim" button should be enabled

data.text1: Click on the "Confirm" button on order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to confirm the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Confirm" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on "Confirm" button on the confirmation window
data.text3:
1. The order should be completed and displayed a success message that saying "Order completed".

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

data.text3:

   1. Source (FA Name)
   2. Order ID (Order External ID)
   3. Time (Order Created Date and Device Time)
   4. Picked by (Claimed User Name)
   5. Claimed At (Claimed Date and Device Time)
   6. Item Name, Qty And Item Price
   7. Menu Item Level comments
   8. Order Level comments
   9. Arabic Translations of the items

data.text3:

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable button of the items
   7. The image of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)
   8. Item level comments
   9. Order level comments

3. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. "Confirm" button should be disabled

5. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

7. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

8. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Ongoing" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

9. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the "Ongoing" orders tab. 

10. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

data.text1: Mark the some of the items as unavailable by clicking on the unavailable buttons
data.text3:
1. The selected item should be marked as unavailable by appearing a red colour unavailable icon on the item image and the item name should be crossed through

2. Available button should be enabled and Unavailable button should be disabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be disabled.

4. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1: Mark all the items as available by clicking on the available buttons
data.text3:
1. The selected items should be marked as available by appearing a green colour available icon on each item image and removing the cross through on the item name

2. Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be enabled.

data.text1: Click on the print icon on the order confirmation screen
data.text3:
Should be able to get the printout from the device printer and should be visible below mentioned details including all the items in the order without considering the item availability.

   1. Source (FA Name)
   2. Order ID (Order External ID)
   3. Time (Order Created Date and Device Time)
   4. Picked by (Claimed User Name)
   5. Claimed At (Claimed Date and Device Time)
   6. Item Name, Qty And Item Price (Only the available items)
   7. Menu Item Level comments
   8. Order Level comments
   9. Arabic Translations of the items

data.text1: Mark all the items as available by clicking on the available buttons
data.text3:
1. All the items should be marked as available by appearing a green colour available icon on each item image.

2. Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be enabled.

4. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1: Click on the "Confirm" button on order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to confirm the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Confirm" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on "Confirm" button on the confirmation window
data.text3:
1. The order should be completed and displayed a success message that saying "Order completed".

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

data.text1: Click on the "Completed" button in "My orders" section
data.text3: Should be navigated to the "Completed" tab

data.text1: Click on the order
data.text3:
1. Should be navigated to the order details screen and should include below mentioned details

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Availabilities of the items
   7. The images of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)
   8. Item level comments
   9. Order level comments

data.text1: Create a Delivery by Merchant Grocery order with multiple items from Talabat
data.text3:
1. The order should be visible under the "Unclaimed" orders.

2. The order count on the "Unclaimed" orders should be increased by 1

3. Below mentioned details should be included in the order under "Unclaimed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Cart icon

4. The "Claim" button should be enabled

data.text1: Click on the "Claim" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be claimed and navigated to order confirmation screen.

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable buttons for each item
   7. The images of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)

3. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. "Confirm" button should be disabled

5. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

7. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

8. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Ongoing" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

9. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the "Ongoing" orders tab. 

10. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

data.text1: Mark some of the items as available by clicking on the available buttons
data.text3:
1. The selected items should be marked as available by appearing a green colour available icon on each item image.

2. Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be disabled.

4. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1: Mark remaining items as unavailable by clicking on the unavailable buttons
data.text3:
1. The selected items should be marked as unavailable by appearing a red colour unavailable icon on each selected item image and the item names should be crossed through

2. Available button should be enabled and Unavailable button should be disabled

3. The "Confirm" button should be enabled.

4. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1: Click on the "Confirm" button on the order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to confirm the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Confirm" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on "Confirm" button on the confirmation window
data.text3:
1. The order should be completed and displayed a success message that saying "Order completed".

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders section.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

data.text3:

data.text1: Click on the "Claim" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be claimed and navigated to order confirmation screen.

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable buttons for each item
   7. Quantity increate & decrease buttons for each item. (Default editable quantity should be equal to the ordered quantity)
   8. The images of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)

3. Quantity increase button should be disabled and quantity decrease button should be enabled

4. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

5. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

7. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

9. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the "Ongoing" orders tab. 

10. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

data.text1: Mark some items as fully available by clicking on the available buttons
data.text3:
1. Selected items should be marked as available by appearing a green colour available icon on each item image.

2. The editable item quantities should be equal to default quantities.

3. The Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. The "Confirm" button should be disabled.

5. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. Order status should be displayed as "In progress" on the "Ongoing" orders tab

data.text1:
Mark some items as partially available by decreasing the quantity by clicking on the "-" button under the items. 

(Decreased quantity values should be greater than to 0 and less than to ordered quantity)
data.text3:
1. Should be able to decrease the item quantity

2. Available and Unavailable buttons should be enabled

3. Quantity increase button and quantity decrease button should be enabled

data.text1: Then click on the available button under the items
data.text3:
1. Selected items should be marked as partially available by appearing a partially green colour available icon on each item image.

2. The editable item quantities should be equal to updated quantities.

3. The left item quantities should be displayed within a bracket against item quantity  

4. The Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

5. The "Confirm" button should be disabled.

data.text1: Mark remaining items as fully unavailable by decreasing the quantity to 0 by clicking on the "-" button under the items.
data.text3:
1. Should be able to decrease the item quantity

2. Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

3. Quantity increase button should be enabled and quantity decrease button should be disabled

data.text1: Then click on the unavailable button under the items
data.text3:
1. The selected items should be marked as unavailable by appearing a red colour unavailable icon on each selected item image and the item names should be crossed through

2. The editable item quantities should be equal to 0.

3. The Available button should be enabled and Unavailable button should be disabled

4. The "Confirm" button should be enabled.

data.text1: Click on the "Confirm" button on order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to confirm the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Confirm" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on "Confirm" button on the confirmation window
data.text3:

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

data.text1: Click on the "Claim" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be claimed and navigated to order confirmation screen.

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable buttons for each item
   7. The images of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)

3. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. "Confirm" button should be disabled

5. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

7. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

8. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Ongoing" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

10. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

2. The order count on the "Unclaimed" orders should be increased by 1

3. Below mentioned details should be included in the order under "Unclaimed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Cart icon

4. The "Claim" button should be enabled

data.text1: Click on the "Claim" button
data.text3:
1. The order should be claimed and navigated to order confirmation screen.

2. Below mentioned details should be included in the order confirmation screen

   1. Order ID
   2. Order Status
   3. Number of items
   4. Item names
   5. Item quantity
   6. Available and unavailable buttons for each item
   7. The images of the items saved in GC should be displayed. (If the  image is not available in GC, default image will be visible.)
   8. Item level comments
   9. Order level comments

3. Available button and Unavailable button should be enabled

4. "Confirm" button should be disabled

5. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order should be removed from the "Unclaimed" orders and added to the "ongoing" orders under "My orders" section.

7. The order count of the "Unclaimed" orders should be decreased by 1 and the order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be increased by 1.

8. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Ongoing" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status
   4. Cart icon

9. Order status should be displayed as "Pending" on the "Ongoing" orders tab. 

10. Order status should be updated as "OrderStarted" on GrubOps 2.0

data.text1: Mark all the items as available by clicking on the available buttons
data.text3:
1. All the items should be marked as available by appearing a green colour available icon on each item image.

2. Available button should be disabled and Unavailable button should be enabled

data.text1: Click on the "Confirm" button on order confirmation screen
data.text3:
1. A confirmation window should be displayed and saying "Are you sure you want to confirm the order".

2. The confirmation window should include the "Confirm" and "Not Now" buttons

data.text1: Click on "Confirm" button on the confirmation window
data.text3:
1. The order should be completed and displayed a success message that saying "Order completed".

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

2. The order should be moved from "ongoing" orders to "Completed" orders under "My orders" section.

3. Below mentioned details should be visible in the order under "Completed" orders.

   1. Order Id
   2. Source
   3. Status

4. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the "Completed" orders tab.

5. Order status should be displayed as "Completed" on the top of the order confirmation screen

6. The order count of the "Ongoing" orders tab under "My orders" should be decreased by 1.

7. Order status should be updated as "OrderCompleted" in GrubOps 2.0.(OrderPrepared, OrderReadyToDispatch and OrderDispatch statuses should be updated automatically before OrderCompleted)

data.text1: Select a specific Modifier and Menu Item from the available options and verify the returned AVERAGE QUANTITY PER DAY.
data.text3:
The displayed average quantity per day value should match the expected average quantity value for the selected modifier and menu item combination over the defined time period.

EX:
Average Quantity Per Day;

ROUND((CAST(SUM(line.qty) as FLOAT) /(DATEDIFF(days, cast(MIN(line.order_created_date_time) as date), CAST(DATEADD(day, 1, MAX(line.order_created_date_time)) as date)))), 2) AS avg_qty

As in the above query snippet, in the current superset implementation the date difference between created time of the first order and the last order within the filtering time range is taken for the average calculation.
Therefore, if the considered modifier’s orders are placed in a single day, number of days will be 1 and the average will be equal to the total according to this calculation.

Time between order dispatched and driver assigned

data.text1: Validate AVG. DRIVER ASSIGNED TO ORDER PICK UP summary card value.

data.text1: Validate AVG. DRIVER CHECK OUT TO DELIVERY TIME summary card value.

Time between driver checkout and delivery

data.text1: Validate AVG. DELIVERY TIME summary card value.

AVG. DELIVERY TIME value should be retrieved correct average delivery time based on below calculation.

Time between order dispatched and order delivered

data.text1: Validate DELIVERY CHARGES summary card value.
data.text3:
DELIVERY CHARGES value should be retrieved correct average delivery charges based on below calculation.

sum(delivery_charge converted to partner currency)

Currency should be showed next to the amount, like 329.373 AED.

data.text1: Select the relevant order Created date range from date filter.
data.text3: Applicable data for the selected date range should be listed successfully.

data.text1: Select a specific location from the available options and verify the returned NO.OF ORDERS.
data.text3: The NO.OF ORDERS in the result panel should match the actual no. of order count associated with the selected brand.

data.text1: Select a specific brand from the available options and verify the returned AVG. ORDER VALUE.
data.text3:
The AVG. ORDER VALUE in the result panel should match the actual average order value associated with the selected location and brand.

'Average Order Value' Widget
AVG(main.gross_sales)

Total Avg Order Value = (avg1 * count1 + avg2 * count2)/(count1 + count2)

data.text1: Select a specific brand from the available options and verify the returned GROSS SALES.
data.text3:
The GROSS SALES in the result panel should match the actual total gross sales value associated with the selected location and brand.

'Gross Sales'
sum(gross_price)

Basic Calculation:
Gross Sales=Total Value of Orders + Delivery Cost (Applicable charges)

data.text1: Select a specific brand from the available options and verify the returned DISCOUNTS.
data.text3:
The DISCOUNTS in the result panel should match the actual total discount value associated with the selected brand.

'Discounts'
SUM(discounts)

Basic Calculation:
(% From Total Item Cost)

data.text1: Select a specific location and brand from the available options and verify the returned TAXES.
data.text3:
The TAXES in the result panel should match the actual total tax value associated with the selected location and brand.

'VAT'
SUM(vat)

Basic Calculation:
((Total Order Amount - Discount) x Y/100) / ( 1 + Y/100)

data.text1: Select a specific location and brand from the available options and verify the returned NET SALES.
data.text3:
The NET SALES in the result panel should match the actual total net sales value associated with the selected location and brand.

'Net Sales'
SUM(main.net_price)

Basic Calculation:
(Total Value of Orders + Delivery Cost - Discount ) - TAX Amount

data.text1: Should be verify total calculation each column separately.
data.text3: When adding separate column together it's total should be equal to total value.

data.name: Verify the ability to install the Picker App in the GC App Store
data.custom_preconditions: User should have logged into GC and navigated to App Store.

data.name: Verify the ability to configure a user with Activate Picker, Deactivate Picker and Picker standard functionality permissions
data.custom_preconditions: User should have logged into GC and it should have access to "User Management" section The Picker application should be installed for the partner account

data.name: Verify the ability to activate the Picker App with a user who has the 'Activate Picker' permission
data.custom_preconditions:
User should have permission to activate the application (Activate Picker permission should be enabled in GC)
Picker app should be installed for the partner account in GrubCenter

data.name: Verify the inability to activate the Picker App with a user when the Picker App is not installed in the partner account
data.custom_preconditions:
User should have permission to activate the application (Activate Picker permission is enabled in GC)
Picker app should not be installed for the partner account in GrubCenter

data.name: Verify the inability to activate the Picker App with a user who doesn't have permission to Activate Picker
data.custom_preconditions:
User shouldn't have permission to activate the application (Activate Picker permission is disabled in GC)
Picker app should be installed for the partner account in GrubCenter

data.name: Verify the availability of a validation message for an invalid email, an invalid password, and both an invalid email and password
data.custom_preconditions:
User should have permission to activate the application (Activate Picker permission is enabled in GC)
Picker app should be installed for the partner account in GrubCenter

data.name: Verify the availability of a validation message for an email address with an invalid format

User should have permission to activate the application (Activate Picker permission is enabled in GC)

data.name: Verify the ability to activate the Picker App for a user who didn't have activation permission before but received it after enabling it in GC
data.custom_preconditions:

Picker app should be installed for the partner account in GrubCenter

data.name: Verify the ability to activate the Picker App with same user in multiple devices

data.name: Verify the ability to activate the picker app with different users in the same kitchen on multiple devices

The Picker app should be installed on 2 devices (Device 1, Device 2)

data.name: User successfully logs into account with a valid email and password.
data.custom_expected: The logo in is successful. The app displays main page of Genie
data.custom_preconditions:
Account is created on GC
Genie app is installed
data.custom_steps_text:
On Genie app

Enter valid credentials of GC: email address and password.

data.name: User enters an invalid email address during the sign-up process.
data.custom_expected:
The app displays an error message indicating that the credentials are incorrect.
Fields are remaining editable for re-attempt
data.custom_preconditions:
Account is created on GC
Genie app is installed
data.custom_steps_text:
On Genie app

Enter an invalid email address (e.g., missing an "@" symbol) or password.

data.name: User sees a list of suggested questions upon opening the chat page.
data.custom_expected:
1. The app displays a list of suggested questions that cover a range of topics and capabilities supported by the app.
  2. The list is easy to read and understand, with clear wording and proper formatting.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: User is on home page

data.name: User selects an example question from the list of suggested questions.
data.custom_expected: The app populates the chat input with the selected question.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
On home page

Tap or click on a suggested question.

data.name: User submits an example question from the list of suggested questions.
data.custom_expected: The app provides an appropriate answer or visualization in response to the submitted example question.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
On home page of Genie

Tap or click on a suggested question and submit it without editing

Tap or click on a suggested question, edit the question, and submit it.

data.name: User submits an edited example question from the list of suggested questions.
data.custom_expected: The app provides an appropriate answer or visualization in response to the edited example question, taking into account the changes made by the user.
data.custom_preconditions: User is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
On home page of Genie

Tap or click on a suggested question, edit the question to change its context or meaning, and submit it.

data.name: User interacts with a user-friendly chat interface.
data.custom_expected:
1. The chat interface is clean and intuitive, with a clear input area for typing questions and a send button or enter/return key functionality for submitting questions.

  2. The chat interface displays the submitted question in the conversation history, and the app responds with an answer.

  3. The chat interface automatically scrolls to the most recent messages when new questions are asked or answers are received.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Open the chat interface and observe its layout.
  2. Type a question into the chat input and submit it.
  3. Interact with the chat interface by asking multiple questions and receiving answers.

data.name: User receives answers to their questions in a clear and readable format within the chat interface.
data.custom_expected:
1. The answer is displayed in a visually distinct format that differentiates it from the user's questions.
  2. The app presents answers in clear and concise language, avoiding jargon and complex phrasing.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Submit a question and observe the format of the app's response.
  2. Analyze the language used in the app's answers.

data.name: User receives visualizations for appropriate questions.
data.custom_expected: The app provides a visualization within the chat interface, making it easy to understand the provided insights.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Submit a question that requires a visualization, such as a chart or graph, to illustrate the answer.

data.name: User experiences consistency in the format of answers provided by the app.
data.custom_expected: The app maintains a consistent format for displaying answers, making it easy for users to identify and understand the information provided.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Ask multiple questions and observe the format of the app's responses.

data.name: User submits a forecast-based question.
data.custom_expected: The app recognizes the question as a forecast-based query and provides a response that specifically addresses the predictive aspect of the question.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Type a forecast-based question related to future trends, sales, or events in the F&B dataset and submit it.

data.name: User submits a forecast-based question.
data.custom_expected: The app recognizes the question as a non-forecast-based query and provides a response that does not include predictions or forecasts.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in the Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Type a non-forecast-based question related to the F&B dataset and submit it.

data.name: User receives accurate and relevant forecasts.
data.custom_expected:
1. The app generates a forecast using historical data, correlations, and patterns in the dataset, considering external factors when necessary.
  2. The app presents the forecast in a clear and understandable format, including visualizations when appropriate.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Submit a forecast-based question and analyze the provided prediction.
  2. Observe the format and clarity of the provided forecast.

data.name: User receives visualizations for appropriate questions.
data.custom_expected: The app provides a visualization within the chat interface, making it easy to understand the provided insights.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Submit a question that requires a visualization, such as a chart or graph, to illustrate the answer.

data.name: User receives a confidence level or margin of error for predictions when possible.
data.custom_expected: The app provides a confidence level or margin of error alongside the prediction to help the user understand the reliability of the forecast.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Submit a forecast-based question that allows for the inclusion of a confidence level or margin of error.

data.name: User submits a question related to the impact of special events on the F&B dataset.
data.custom_expected: The app sends notifications or alerts to inform users about upcoming special events and their potential impact according to the user's preferences.
data.custom_steps_text: Set up notification preferences for upcoming special events.

data.name: User receives notifications about upcoming special events.
data.custom_expected:
1. The app sends notifications or alerts to inform users about upcoming special events and their potential impact according to the user's preferences.
  2. The app displays information about upcoming special events, either in the form of a list or a calendar.
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Set up notification preferences for upcoming special events.
  2. Observe the app's main screen or dashboard.

data.name: User customizes notification preferences for special events.
data.custom_expected: The app allows users to customize their notification preferences, such as frequency and types of events they want to be notified about.
data.custom_steps_text: Access the app's settings or notification preferences.

data.name: User views a list or calendar of upcoming special events within the app.
data.custom_expected: The app provides an option to view a list or calendar of upcoming special events, allowing users to plan accordingly.
data.custom_steps_text: Access the app's special events list or calendar feature.

data.name: User submits a question that requires a data visualization.
data.custom_expected: The app generates an appropriate visualization based on the question and displays it within the chat interface or as a separate screen when necessary.
data.custom_steps_text: Type a question that would benefit from a data visualization, such as a bar chart, line chart, or pie chart, and submit it.

data.name: User submits a question that requires a data visualization.
data.custom_expected: The visualization is clear, easy to read, and accurately represents the underlying data. Labels, legends, and tooltips are provided as needed to help users understand the visualization.
data.custom_steps_text: Observe the generated visualization.

data.name: User customizes a data visualization based on their preferences.
data.custom_expected:
1. The app provides options for users to customize visualizations according to their preferences.
  2. The app allows users to refine the visualization by applying filters or adjusting data parameters as desired.
  3. The app enables users to modify visualization styles to better suit their preferences.
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Access the options for customizing a visualization (e.g., chart type, time frame, or data groupings).
  2. Apply filters or adjust data parameters to refine a visualization.
  3. Modify visualization styles, such as color schemes, axis scales, or data point markers.

data.name: User experiences consistent visualization preferences across different questions and answers.
data.custom_expected: The app retains user preferences for visualizations, ensuring a consistent experience across different questions and answers.
data.custom_steps_text: Ask multiple questions and observe if the app retains the user's visualization preferences.

data.name: User submits a question or request to compare specific data points.
data.custom_expected:
1. The app understands the context of the comparison request and compares the requested data points, displaying the results in a clear and understandable format.

  2. The comparison includes relevant parameters, such as orders, channels, price, title, description, images, location, brand, sales, discounts, customer data, operational data, and nutritional values.
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Type a question or request that compares specific data points (e.g., comparing sales of two different products) and submit it.
  2. Observe the comparison results.

data.name: User receives recommendations based on data comparisons.
data.custom_expected:
1. The app analyzes the comparison results to identify trends, differences, or similarities and generates recommendations based on the findings.

  2. The recommendations are relevant and actionable, providing the user with valuable insights.

  3. The app enables users to modify visualization styles to better suit their preferences.The recommendations are presented in a clear and concise manner within the chat page, making it easy for users to understand and act upon the insights.
data.custom_steps_text:
1. Submit a question or request that compares specific data points and observe the app's response.

  2. Examine the recommendations provided by the app.

  3. Observe how the recommendations are presented within the chat page.

data.name: Response Accuracy
data.custom_expected: Test ability to provide accurate and relevant responses to various user queries.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Input a range of questions on different topics and evaluate the accuracy of the answers.

data.name: Handling Ambiguity
data.custom_expected: Check the Genie's ability to seek clarification or provide contextually appropriate responses.
data.custom_preconditions: The user is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text: Input ambiguous or vague queries

data.name: Error Handling
data.custom_expected: Check the response. Make sure Genie provides helpful guidance or clarifications
data.custom_steps_text: Enter invalid or nonsensical input

data.name: Complex Queries
data.custom_expected: Check how well Genie can break down and respond to those questions
data.custom_steps_text: Input complex questions that involve multiple elements

data.name: Negative Queries
data.custom_expected: Test the bot's response when users express dissatisfaction, confusion, or negative sentiments.

data.name: Long and Short Inputs
data.custom_expected: The response is generated for both short query and more detailed one in appropriate way
data.custom_preconditions: User is logged in Genie app
data.custom_steps_text:
1. On Genie app
  2. Enter short query in a chat text box
  3. Check the response
  4. Enter long query in a chat text box
  5. Check the response

data.name: Performance and Speed
data.custom_expected: Evaluate the Genie's response time and ensure it handles user queries promptly

data.name: Cross-Platform Testing
data.custom_steps_text: Test the bot on various platforms (IOS & Android) and devices (phones & tablets) to ensure consistent performance.
